column4: is there a way to make the desktop installer 'ignore' all disks in a system bar the one selected for install?
easiest way would be to just unplug them
but the installer won't install on drives that you don't tell it to
I just tried an install, and it put grub on a different disk than the os was installed to
and 'broke' a raid 0
are you aware that raid0 is slower and less fault tolerent then two single disks?
it's just a fakeraid thing on an ich9 controller, and yes im aware about the tollerence and marginal speed differences :)
anyways, does the installer recognize your raid0 or is it displaying both disks seperatly? softraid, fakeraid, or hardraid?
its displaying the raid0 disks seperately
and im installing on a different, non raided disk that is connected to the same ich9 controller
I would just manually install grub then
!grub | jaymes0
that is, if thats all that its missing
can i stop grub from being installed on the desktop installer?
no
not even on the alternate installer
it's missing yes, but my issue is that it installs on a different (and raided...) disk, breaking it
alright, but you already installed everything but grub on the intended disk, correct?
yeah
alright, so install grub, in the future, unplug your raided drives during installation
or prior to installation I should say
